<p>If u=sinhxcosy then the analytic function f(z)=u+jv is</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\rm \left[ \begin{array}{l} \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} {\frac{3}{{{1^2}{{.2}^2}}}}&amp;\ \ \ 0&amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ 0&amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}}&amp;\ \ \ \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}\\ \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} {\frac{3}{{{1^2}{{.2}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{5}{{{2^2}{{.3}^2}}}}&amp;\ \ \ 0&amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}}&amp;\ \ \ \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}\\ \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} {\frac{3}{{{1^2}{{.2}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{5}{{{2^2}{{.3}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{7}{{{3^2}{{.4}^2}}}}&amp;\ \ \ 0 \end{array}}&amp;\ \ \ \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}\\ \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} {\frac{3}{{{1^1}{{.2}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{5}{{{2^2}{{.3}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{7}{{{3^2}{{.4}^2}}}}&amp;{\frac{9}{{{4^2}{{.5}^2}}}} \end{array}}&amp; \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}\\ \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots \end{array}}&amp;\ \ \ \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \end{array}\\ \begin{array}{{}{c}} {\begin{array}{{}{c}} \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots &amp;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \vdots \end{array}}&amp;\ \ \ \vdots &amp; \vdots &amp;{\frac{{2n + 1}}{{{n^2} {{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}}} \end{array} \end{array} \right]\)</span></p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\ the\ sum\ of\ eigen\ values\ will\ be \ldots \ldots\)</span></p>

sol.value:
<p>Sum of eigen value = trace of matrix</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\begin{array}{l} = \frac{3}{{{1^2}{{.2}^2}}} + \frac{5}{{{2^2}{{.3}^2}}} + \frac{7}{{{3^2}{{.4}^2}}} + \ldots \cdots \cdots + \frac{{2n + 1}}{{{n^2}.{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}}\\ = \left( {\frac{1}{{{1^2}}} - \frac{1}{{{2^2}}}} \right) + \left( {\frac{1}{{{2^2}}} - \frac{1}{{{3^2}}}} \right) + \left( {\frac{1}{{{3^2}}} - \frac{1}{{{4^2}}}} \right) + \ldots \cdots \cdots + \left[ {\frac{1}{{{n^2}}} - \frac{1}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}}} \right]\\ = \frac{1}{{{1^2}}} - \frac{1}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}}\\ = 1 - \frac{1}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}} = \frac{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2} - 1}}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}} = \frac{{{n^2} + 2n}}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}}\\ = \frac{{n\left( {n + 2} \right)}}{{{{\left( {n + 1} \right)}^2}}} \end{array}\)</span></p>

en.value: <p>The solution of Differential Equation &nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(y'' - 2y' + 5y = 4\delta \left( t \right)\)</span>, when&nbsp;&nbsp;where &delta;(t) is unit impulse function. Given: y(0)=0, y&#39;(0)=0</p>

sol.value: <p><span class="math-tex">\(\begin{array}{l} L\left[ {y'' - 2y' + 5y} \right] = 4L\left\{ {\delta \left( t \right)} \right\}\\ \Rightarrow L\left( {y''} \right) - 2L\left( {y'} \right) + 5L\left( y \right) = 4\\ \Rightarrow {s^2}L\left( y \right) - sy\left( 0 \right) - y'\left( 0 \right) - \left\{ {2sL\left( y \right) - 2y'\left( 0 \right)} \right\} + 5L\left( y \right) = 4\\ \Rightarrow \left| {{s^2} - 2s + 5} \right|L\left( y \right) = 4\\ \Rightarrow L\left( y \right) = \frac{4}{{{s^2} - 2s + 5}} = \frac{4}{{{{\left( {s - 1} \right)}^2} + 4}} = \frac{{2 \times 2}}{{{{\left( {s - 1} \right)}^2} + {2^2}}}\\ y = {L^{ - 1}}\left[ {2*\frac{2}{{{{\left( {s - 1} \right)}^2} + {2^2}}}} \right]\\ y = 2{e^t}sin2t \end{array}\)</span></p>
sol.name: Shashi

en.value: <p>The directional derivative&nbsp;of f = xy<sup>2</sup>z<sup>2</sup> at (1,1,-1) along the direction of vector&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\vec a = \hat i + \hat j + \hat k\)</span>&nbsp;is</p>

sol.value: <p><span class="math-tex">\(\begin{array}{l} {\left. {\nabla F = {y^2}{z^2}\hat i + 2xy{z^2}\hat j + 2x{y^2}z\hat k} \right|_{1,1, - 1}}\\ = \hat i + 2\hat j - 2\hat k\\ D.D = \nabla F.\overrightarrow {\frac{a}{{\left| {\vec a} \right|}}} = \left( {\hat i + 2\hat j - 2\hat k} \right).\frac{{\left( {\hat i + \hat j + \hat k} \right)}}{{\sqrt 3 }}\\ = \frac{{1 + 2 - 2}}{{\sqrt 3 }} = \frac{1}{{\sqrt 3 }} \end{array}\)</span></p>
sol.name: Shashi

<p>Note that permutation of incidences on a particular day is irrelevant here.</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\(\begin{array}{l} V = \mathop \smallint \limits_{ - 3}^3 \pi {y^2}dx\\ = \mathop \smallint \limits_{ - 3}^3 \pi \frac{4}{9}\left( {9 - {x^2}} \right)dx = 2\mathop \smallint \limits_{ 0}^3 \pi \frac{4}{9}\left( {9 - {x^2}} \right)dx\\ = \left. {\frac{{8\pi }}{9}\left( {9x - \frac{{{x^3}}}{3}} \right)} \right|_0^3 = 50.26 \end{array}\)</span></p>
